In order to discuss whether our algorithms converge to this unique Nash equilibrium under Assumption 1, we consider the neighbor of Nash equilibrium and define sufficient small deviation from the Nash equilibrium, i.e.,  $\delta \coloneqq x - x^{*}1$  and  $\epsilon \coloneqq y - y^{*}1$ . Here, we assume that these deviations have the same scale  $O(\delta) \coloneqq O(\delta_{i}) = O(\epsilon_{i})$  for all  $i$ .
